sentences.en: A certain person, who shall remain nameless, forgot to lock the front door.
sentences.cn: 某人忘了锁前门，名字我就不说了。

sentences.en: A chill enveloped him and he was weighed down by a nameless despair.
sentences.cn: 他被冷气包围着,被一种莫名的忧郁压迫着.

sentences.en: He was troubled by nameless fears.
sentences.cn: 难以名状的恐惧困扰着他.

sentences.en: I grew to await it with a nameless dread.
sentences.cn: 我心头发生了无名的恐怖,期待着.

sentences.en: I was seized by a nameless horror.
sentences.cn: 我为不可名状的恐慌所控制.

sentences.en: It was vague , intangible , appealing only to some strange, nameless sixth sense.
sentences.cn: 这桩事是虚无缥缈 、 不可捉摸的, 只有通过什么不可思议, 难以名状的第六感觉才会领会.

sentences.en: It was vague, intangible, appeling only to some strange, nameless sixth sense.
sentences.cn: 这桩事是虚无漂缈 、 不可捉摸的,只有通过什么不可思议, 难以名状的第六感觉才会领会.

sentences.en: She suffered from the nameless pain of existence.
sentences.cn: 她遭受着生存的无名痛苦.

sentences.en: She was seized with a nameless terror.
sentences.cn: 她感到一种不可名状的恐惧.

sentences.en: Somebody, who will remain nameless, actually managed to drink two bottles of champagne!
sentences.cn: 有个人, 我就不指名道姓了, 居然喝下了两瓶香槟酒!

sentences.en: Stanley felt a nameless anxiety rising in him.
sentences.cn: 史坦利觉得心头涌起一股不可名状的忧虑.

sentences.en: The author of the book shall be nameless.
The sunflower blushed to own the nameless flower as her kin.
sentences.cn: 向日葵羞于把无名的花朵看作它的同胞.

sentences.en: They can have their cases rejected, without reasons being given, by nameless officials.
sentences.cn: 他们的诉求可能会被一些不知姓名的官员们莫名其妙地驳回。

sentences.en: thousands of nameless and faceless workers
sentences.cn: 成千上万默默无闻的工人

words.tran_cn: 命名的；指定的；被指名的
命名；任命（name的过去分词）；称呼
命名，任命；指定；称呼；提名；叫出
不可名状的，难以形容的；匿名的

trans.tran_cn: 不知名的，无名的，<文>不可名状的，（因听者知道你所指或不想令某人难堪）不会指名道姓
trans.tran_en: used when you want to say that someone has done something wrong but without mentioning their name, especially to criticize them in a friendly way
